page.title: 17Religion
page.content: There are two Church in Wales churches within the block - one at Whitton and one at Pilleth. Not many people go to church and there are not usually more than ten at Whitton. Pilleth church is open only in the summer because it is high on a hill and can be cold and draughty in the winter - it has no electricity. The churches are full at special times like Harvest or Easter or Christmas. The Rector at Whitton has to look after several different parishes. There is a Baptist chapel two miles away and people go there from this area. It is a struggle for the churches to keep going although they get a lot of tourists going in to have a look round with many coming from abroad.
